main_definition: Gregory is not an idiom but a common English name derived from Greek, typically used as a given name.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A variant of the name Gregory which originates from Latin 'Gregorius', meaning 'praised by the Lord'.
meanings_and_examples.example: Saint Gregory I was Pope from 590 to 604.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An archaic or variant spelling of the name Greg, often used in historical texts.
meanings_and_examples.example: The Greg brothers were renowned for their exploration during the gold rush era.
